paper_abstract: This article examines the integration of gigascale Ternary Content Addressable Memory (TCAM) systems based on resistive memories within a general-purpose computing platform. TCAM density is improved by novel resistive memory cells that exploit phase change and spin-torque transfer magnetoresistive RAM technologies. The proposed tcam system achieves average speedups of 3 to 4.5 times and average energy reductions of 5 to 8 times as compared to a conventional RAM-based system.
paper_title: RESISTIVE TERNARY CONTENT ADDRESSABLE MEMORY SYSTEMS FOR DATA-INTENSIVE COMPUTING
